edu.stanford.pigir.pigudf

Class AnchorAltTitleText

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.pig.EvalFunc<org.apache.pig.data.Tuple>
      • edu.stanford.pigir.pigudf.AnchorAltTitleText

  • public class AnchorAltTitleText
extends org.apache.pig.EvalFunc<org.apache.pig.data.Tuple>
    Given an HTML string, return a tuple of strings that comprise the anchor texts in the HTML. All HTML tags are stripped from the anchor texts. Optionally two more text fragments can be extracted: the body of the ALT attribute to the image element, and the body of the TITLE attribute to other HTML elements. The latter is not to be confused with the HTML page title. @see W3Schools standard title}. NOTE: does not properly handle embedded escaped double quotes. <... ALT="foo \"bar\" baz"...> will return: foo \ Which of anchor text, alt text, and title text is included in the ouput is determined by the constructor. Passing the string "true" for the getAnchor, getAlt, and/or getTitle parameters will causes the respective text fragments to be included. Similarly, passing the string "false" will suppress the respective type of text fragment.
    Author:
    paepcke

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnchorAltTitleText

        public AnchorAltTitleText(String getAnchor,
                  String getAlt,
                  String getTitle)
                   throws IOException
        Constructor used to determine which types of text fragments are extracted from HTML. Note that at least one of the parameters must be the string "true". Note that these parameters are *strings*, not booleans. This is because I don't see how to pass booleans from a Pig script.
        Parameters:
        getAnchor - String "true" or "false" to control whether anchor text is included
        getAlt - String "true" or "false" to control whether ALT tag text is included
        getTitle - String "true" or "false" to control whether TITLE tag text is included
        Throws:
        IOException
